intro: Simaba maiana, commonly known as the Maiana hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to white. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal and moist environments, often found in sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in tropical and subtropical regions.
